about.short: WanderRest (ex-Wander365) is a full-stack travel experience platform that helps Indian travelers discover, customize, and book curated trips, while giving the travel team a powerful yet simple CRM to manage leads, packages, and itineraries.
about.long:
WanderRest started as a passion project to simplify how Indian travelers discover and book curated trips, weekend getaways, treks, and experiences. The goal was to make trip planning feel less like a chore and more like a conversation with a trusted travel partner. Under Dew & Company (DewCo), Wander365 evolved into WanderRest – a modern travel brand that combines clean design, smart automation, and human-curated itineraries.

The public website helps users explore destinations, view detailed packages, and submit enquiries. On the backend, an internal admin CRM + CMS lets the team manage packages, itineraries, leads, and follow-ups in one place. The platform is designed as a travel OS that can later be extended into a white-label, multi-tenant solution for other travel agencies.

roles_and_responsibilities: Defined product vision, feature scope, and roadmap from MVP to scalable platform.
Designed user journeys, wireframes, and high-fidelity UI for both public site and admin CRM.
Implemented front-end, back-end APIs, and database schema.
Set up lead capture flows, basic analytics, and SEO-ready content structures.
Planned architecture to support future multi-tenant white-label use.
objectives: Build a modern, trustworthy online presence for a tours and travel brand.
Create a conversion-focused website that turns visitors into qualified enquiries.
Centralize all leads, itineraries, and packages into one CRM instead of Excel/WhatsApp.
Design an internal system that is simple enough for daily use but scalable for multiple agencies.
Lay the foundation for a future multi-tenant, white-label travel platform.

public_website: Destination- and theme-based browsing (weekend getaways, treks, honeymoons, workations, etc.)
Detailed package pages with day-wise itinerary, inclusions, exclusions, FAQs, and gallery.
Smart enquiry forms connected to CRM with lead source and UTM tracking.
SEO-friendly blog section for travel guides, tips, and destination content.
Trust elements: testimonials, FAQs, safety notes, and brand story sections.
WhatsApp-ready share links for itineraries and packages.
admin_crm: Lead inbox with filters by source (website, WhatsApp, referral, campaigns).
Lead pipeline statuses: New, Contacted, Follow-up, Converted, Lost.
Package and itinerary management with reusable templates and day-wise breakdown.
Pricing matrix for seasonal pricing, per-person cost, and add-ons.
Quote and itinerary export (PDF/print-friendly) for sharing with clients.
Basic reporting for leads, conversion rate, top destinations, and channels.

frontend: Component-based UI with reusable sections for packages and itineraries
backend: RESTful API (Node.js / Django / FastAPI – configurable as per deployment)
Role-based access control for admin users
Structured models for leads, packages, itineraries, and pricing
database: Relational DB (PostgreSQL/MySQL) or Firestore (Firebase) depending on environment
integrations: Google Business Profile strategy for reviews and local discovery
WhatsApp deep links for sharing packages and quotes
Email notifications via SMTP / transactional mail provider
Google Analytics with UTM-based campaign tracking
hosting_devops: Basic CI/CD pipeline for automated builds and deployments

discovery_and_strategy.summary: Requirement gathering, brand positioning, feature scoping, and platform architecture planning.

design_and_ux.summary: User flows, wireframes, component library, visual design for website and CRM.

development_v1.summary: Core feature development for public site, enquiry flow, and basic admin CRM.

launch_v1.summary: Production release with core booking enquiry flow and CRM.

rebrand_and_expansion.summary: Brand refresh, UI polish, improved CRM features, and platform positioning as WanderRest.

ongoing.summary: Continuous enhancements, SEO content, and preparations for multi-tenant support.

budget.notes: Values represent equivalent full project value including strategy, UX/UI, development, and initial SEO setup.

challenges: Client operations were spread across WhatsApp, Excel, and Google Docs, causing lost leads and inconsistent follow-ups.
The founders wanted an all-in-one system but had limited technical background.
Need to keep admin CRM extremely simple for daily use while secretly being scalable for multi-tenant future use.
Standardizing itineraries, pricing, and add-ons without making content creation heavy for the team.
solutions: Designed a minimal, focused CRM with clear stages and simple forms instead of overwhelming options.
Created structured data models for packages, itineraries, and pricing to reduce duplication and confusion.
Separated core platform logic from brand layer to allow future white-label/multi-tenant rollout.
Built reusable itinerary and quote templates to speed up client responses and follow-ups.

qualitative: Centralized lead and package management in one system instead of scattered sheets and chats.
Enabled faster response to enquiries using reusable itineraries and quote templates.
Created a brand-ready, SEO-friendly website suitable for both organic traffic and future paid campaigns.
Laid the foundation for evolving the product into a white-label platform for other travel agencies.
